intro: Callista lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. Callista lancifolia is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
